intro: Basanacantha micracantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and diverse morphological features. The plant typically has alternate, narrow, and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Basanacantha micracantha is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
